body.p: Dr Sir. The within Communication is from Mr Savage recently elected County judge in my county. The man Hedges to whom he alludes was recently engaged in tearing down and burning a house of ill fame in his neighborhood, and was fined in the Mason Circuit at its last July term $188 for his share in the matter He was unable to either pay or replevy the fine and is in jail. I as protem altr. for the Commwlth promoted him and four others all of whom were fined. Hedges is a poor miserable creature, without much sense & perhaps has been punished sufficiently. he has now been in jail altogether about 3 months. His two sons have volunteered and gone to the army, and on his wifes account I think it would be well to let him out. I would be glad if you would release him.

I am very Respectfully
Your Obt Servt
H. Taylor
